intro: Lantana involucrata f. leucocarpa, commonly known as white fruit lantana, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are typically white or yellow when mature. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Lantana involucrata f. leucocarpa is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun.
